      ReportingLevel handle(ExceptionReport exceptionReport, ExceptionContext exceptionContext)
      Called to properly add exception information to the ExceptionReport which is then used to generate a script trace or ApplicationCrashReport

      Typically you would just add your exception to the report with report.addException( this ); and provide some possible unique debug information, if any exists.

      • handle

        public ReportingLevel handle(ExceptionReport exceptionReport,
                             ExceptionContext exceptionContext)
        Description copied from interface: ExceptionContext
        Called to properly add exception information to the ExceptionReport which is then used to generate a script trace or ApplicationCrashReport

        Typically you would just add your exception to the report with report.addException( this ); and provide some possible unique debug information, if any exists.

        Specified by:
        handle in interface ExceptionContext
        Parameters:
        exceptionReport - The ExceptionReport to fill
        exceptionContext - The Exception Context
        Returns:
        The reporting level produced by this handler, returning null will cause the application to conclude it's own handling procedure, which is essentially the same as returning ReportingLevel.E_UNHANDLED.

        public boolean hasCause()
